column1: # Test Commands for Instructors: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Book
This CSV file contains a list of key commands instructors can run locally to validate the reproducibility and correctness of the book's examples and overall system.

column4: DESCRIPTION
column6: EXPECTED_OUTPUT`

column4: DESCRIPTION
column6: EXPECTED_OUTPUT

column4: Verify ROS 2 Humble installation and basic talker/listener example.
column5: ros2 run demo_nodes_cpp talker & ros2 run demo_nodes_py listener
column6: Talker and Listener nodes communicating successfully.

column4: Verify node connections using rqt_graph.
column6: Graphical representation of nodes and topics.

column4: Verify late-joining subscriber receives messages with transient_local QoS.
column5: ros2 run my_package qos_publisher.py (run first); sleep 5; ros2 run my_package qos_subscriber.py
column6: Subscriber receives messages published before its launch.

column4: Verify add_two_ints service.
column5: ros2 run my_package add_two_ints_server & ros2 service call /add_two_ints std_srvs/srv/AddTwoInts '{a: 1, b: 2}'
column6: Service returns sum: 3.

column4: Verify fibonacci action server.
column5: ros2 run my_package fibonacci_action_server & ros2 action send_goal /fibonacci example_interfaces/action/Fibonacci '{order: 5}'
column6: Action client receives feedback and final result (sequence 0 1 1 2 3 5).

column4: Verify simulated robot teleoperation with keyboard.
column5: ros2 launch my_robot_launch spawn_robot.launch.py & ros2 run teleop_twist_keyboard teleop_twist_keyboard
column6: Simulated robot moves according to keyboard input.

column4: Verify custom Gazebo world loads correctly.
column6: Gazebo GUI shows defined objects.

column4: Validate custom robot URDF file.
column6: Output: 'URDF file is valid'.

column4: Visualize custom robot URDF in RViz2.
column6: RViz2 displays robot model correctly.

column4: Verify custom robot control in Gazebo via ROS 2.
column6: Robot moves in Gazebo in response to controller commands.

column4: Monitor simulated lidar data in RViz2.
column6: RViz2 displays lidar scans; terminal shows raw lidar data.

column4: Verify ROS 2 communication with Unity.
column5: ros2 run teleop_twist_keyboard teleop_twist_keyboard & Launch Unity project and run scene
column6: Robot in Unity moves according to keyboard input.

column4: Verify Isaac Sim installation and sample scene load.
column5: Launch Isaac Sim; Load a sample scene from the UI
column6: Sample scene loads and interacts correctly.

column4: Verify programmatic scene creation in Isaac Sim.
column6: Isaac Sim launches (or runs headless) and shows sphere falling.

column4: Verify URDF import into Isaac Sim.
column6: URDF robot model appears staged in Isaac Sim.

column4: Verify ROS 2 teleoperation of Isaac Sim robot.
column5: ros2 run teleop_twist_keyboard teleop_twist_keyboard & python path/to/isaac_ros2_teleop.py
column6: Isaac Sim robot moves according to keyboard input.

column4: Verify synthetic data collection.
column6: Annotated images and metadata saved to output directory.

column4: Verify real-time object detection in Isaac Sim.
column6: Isaac Sim viewport shows bounding boxes on detected objects.

column4: Verify real-time speech transcription.
column6: Terminal displays accurate real-time transcription of spoken words.

column4: Verify structured command parsing.
column5: ros2 run vla_package ros2_nlu_node.py & ros2 topic pub /asr_text std_msgs/msg/String 'data: \move forward one meter\"'"
column6: Terminal or subscribed topic shows parsed JSON: `{'intent': 'move'

column4: Verify planned action sequence execution.
column5: ros2 launch vla_system_launch vla_system.launch.py & ros2 topic pub /nlu_commands my_msgs/msg/Command '{intent: \clear_table\"
column6: target: \"red cup\"}'"
column7: Simulated robot executes sequence of pick/place actions.

column4: Verify full VLA pipeline with complex command.
column6: please clear the table. Start with the red cup.\""

column4: Verify Docusaurus site builds without errors.
column6: Build completes with 'successfully built' message and no errors.

column4: Check for broken links in Docusaurus site.
column5: cd book && npm run docusaurus check-links
column6: No broken links reported.
